bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, October 8, 1928

div1.p: Carter sends a list of bibliographical references for the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, October 8, 1928
div1.opener:
Book, Bibliography
Frost
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N.W.
Washington, D. C.
Monday, October 8, 1928.
Dr. Wade H. Frost,
School of Hygiene and Public Health,
615 North Wolfe Street,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Jack:
div1.p:
(1) I am herein enclosing completed refs. for
i.p.8--- (a) Boyce, Sir Rubert (1911) infection (aegypti) retained 3 months...
i. p. 8: Durham, H. E. (vs) Goeldi (though I still hope we can get Goeldi's ref.
i.p.11: Cavassa, Nicholas, (1922) re effect of temperature on sex-ration aegypti.
i. p. 36: Rand, Isaac (1799) Verified quotation.
i. p. 36: Warren, H. (1799) as quoted by Tytler, James (1799) re epidemic Boston 1798.
Library Card for Marchoux, E. Salimbeni, A. and Simond, P. L.
ii. p. 52: Lind, James (1792) quoting Sir John Elliott re epidemic, Naples 1764)
ii. 68-9: " " (1792) O. K. save for expression “Coast fevers.)

(2) I am also sending two library cards for Busto y Blanco (a) as quoted by
Le Roy de Méricourt (the one we used) (b) One for the original edition in
case we have a chance to see it later in N. Y. at the Hispanic Library.

(3) Cards for Pringle, Sir John (1810) Incomplete, but we've been over every edition
of Pringle in the S. G's Library and its the very best we can do. I'll send
you the book when you get to the African section if you so desire, but I am sure
the ref. to the “appearance of the sick and dead” is not there.

(4) Re The books you wish sent over, unfortunately I left the N. O. Med. and Sur. Journals
containing Nott's articles and I can't get out any more books until I return those.
I phoned Miss Fredericks and she says she is sending them to-day.

(4') I think that I can send all of the books you wished to see except
Warren, Henry (1740)
Malignant fever in Barbadoes etc.

This book is falling to pieces and cannot be taken from the Library of the S. G.
I am, however, enclosing cards containing copy of that part of Warren's book relating to
introduction of y. f. from Martinique to Barbadoes. I knew it is much easier to take [unclear]
in data when one actually sees the printed page, but this is the very best that can be done
short of your seeing it at the S. G's Library.

Sorry for the appearance of this letter, but my typewriter has been much injured by
work on Library cards and the elderly drawing pen with which I have addressed the en-
velope is equally bad.
With much love to the Susans and[unclear] trusting to have some more material for your soon,
div1.closer: Most truly yours Laura A. Carter Enclosures.
